meanings.definition: To join or unite in a close relationship.
meanings.sent1: The two friends consociated to work on a project together.
meanings.sent2: The team consociated their efforts to achieve success.
meanings.sent3: The cats consociated to catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The stars consociated in the night sky, forming beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The ingredients consociated perfectly to create a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: Associated or connected with something else.
meanings.sent1: The consociated colors of the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent2: The consociated events led to a surprising outcome.
meanings.sent3: The consociated books on the shelf seemed to whisper stories to each other.
meanings.sent4: The consociated melodies in the song intertwined seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The consociated ideas sparked a creative discussion among the group.
